author: Duq
title: Smell Zwell???
review:
Maybe it's a Dutch thing but I really like the colour scheme of this car. While the stickers certainly add to the race car feel the design doesn't need stickers to look good - and that's always a good sign. It's not quite as good-looking as last years Blue Bullet but it's definitely in my top 3 of the past few years.

The design is similar to a number of the Le Mans type racers but this is the first open wheel Tiny Turbo outside of the off-roaders.

You'll find some nice parts in this set; three brackets, some tiles (a black 2x4) and grilles and two parts you rarely find outside the Tiny Turbo series; the spoiler part and that rounded wedge part that's used for the windows.

The imaginary team name 'Smell Zwell' must be one of the strangest names Lego has come up with. I wonder if this is a case of Donkey Kong (the famous translation mistake at Nintendo that gave the early video game classic its strange name)...

An interesting design built with interesting parts in nice colours. What's not to like?

author: fox171171
title: Smells good! ;)
review:
A nice race car. Pretty good for a small part count.

Pros

  • Nice car, for a small model. Rolls well.
  • Some nice parts.
  • Doesn't look too bad without the stickers.

Cons

  • Lots of stickers.
  • Colour issues.

I bought this set to build for something to do for a few minutes, then to use for parts. Plus when my 3 month old gets old enough for LEGO, I'm sure he'll want some wheels to build with.

I'm happy with the pieces. I hate stickers, but never intended to use them, so it isn't too much of a bother for me, but others may be annoyed.

My main complaint is that the orange colour is not consistent. Similar pieces (two tiles for example) seem to be the same, but the 1x2 grille is a slightly different shade than the 1x2 tile. The grille does seem to match the 1x4 tile. This poor colour matching is why I gave a lower "overall rating" than the other categories would suggest. (8302 suffers from this problem as well, but with the green pieces.)

I guess the car smells good, as the sticker says "Smell Zwell".
